title: Ticket #1770: Consider -sortrank as option to condor_status/condor_q
description:
I ran into a case where I wanted to ask the question:

Can condor_q show me the job queue sorted by runtime?

This led me to notice that we don't have any good means of providing user controlled sorting of the output of classad from either condor_q or condor_status.

Something like: 

> condor_q -sortrank 'QDate'
> condor_q -sortrank 'CumulativeSuspensionTime'
# Do multifield sorting...
> condor_q -sortrank 'Owner' -sortrank 'RemoteUserCpu' \
  -format '%s ' Owner \
  -format '%s ' RemoteUserCpu \
  -format '%s\n' Machine

Then, it'd be nice to do group by or count like operations with classads, such as counting how many machines fall into buckets of 10G free disk space.

I was interested in it from a point of view where I wanted to find out some statistical information from a cluster, such as "Do the machines on these subnets have lower load average than the machines not on those subnets."

This turned out to be pretty hard to answer without running a bunch of queries and writing perl to join it all together.
